p: Bassolé et al. [ 37] tested the efficiency of Cymbopogon proximus, Lippia multiflora and Ocimum canum essential oils against An. gambiae eggs and found that the LC 50 values ranged from 61.9 to 188.8 mg·L −1. Eggs of An. stephensi were susceptible to the essential oils of Cinnamomum zeylanicum, Cuminum cyminum, Curcuma longa, Juniperus macropoda, Ocimum basilicum, Pimpinella anisum, Zingiber officinalis and Cinnamomum zeylanicum. LC 95 varied from 32.2 to 172.8 mg·L −1 [ 36].
